name: NY Pizza Grill | DC - Capitol Hill

reviews.text: I've ordered from them once or twice before, never really impressed but it wasn't horrible. I went to a relatives home on 7/1/22 ordered food. Ate most of it, only to realize it was a fly/flies in it. I took pictures and called to complain and the manger cursed me out. I honestly couldn't believe the way he spoke to me, as if I was making the claim up. He said there are no flies in there. Clearly there ARE. I honestly expected a refund and an apology, especially since i had proof and ended up getting sick from the food. I thought they would be apologetic but there was no empathy for this horrendous experience. I will never eat anything from this place again.
This place has great food with a wide selection and is one of my favorite spot. The food is always hot and fresh. The customer service is top notch all the time. Highly recommend it!!

Ordered a "hand tossed pizza." What arrived was very clearly machine made. Markings on the undercarriage (pictured) shows that a roller was used. There is also a dashed line along the edge of the crust (also pictured) which again indicates the dough was machine made. The pizza looked and tasted like a frozen pizza. I have serious doubts that human hands even touched the pizza at all before it was placed in the box.

Delivery driver also ditched my order in my hotel lobby without calling me. I included the number to call in the delivery description. Nope, he just left it in the lobby and left. Had I not walked downstairs, I never would have found it. By the time I got down there, the machine-made pizza was cold.

Fried zucchini was good. A little soggy, but still okay.

Don't bother with the pizza here, though.
Yummy yummy I got New York pizza in my tummy. Thanks Katie!!! You always a pleasure to see.

Check NY Pizza Grill They just added New things to the menu! I had the New Santa features chicken burger with the chipotle fries. Man it hit the spot. My friend had the midtown pizza with crushed red peppers! And it was awesome!!

People here are awesome. A shame they've had some unruly ppl come in there over the years and try to take their money illegally.. But they are really good pizza makers and I love this place. Be sure to tip these guys and gals, even if you only carry out! They make the best pizzas.

All of my experiences with this Papa Johns in particular have always been great. My food is always fresh, hot, ready, and tasty. When I go to this papajohns, Kim is definitely my goto person and truly  a 5 star  employee. Kim can single handedly do everything in there, blindfolded at that. I'm sure! Kim is very consistent 👏  🙌  and not only with the pizza but also with the customer service skills too. 👌  This is by far my favorite Papa Johns!
Garbage franchise, food marked as delivered in the app and no one has shown up 15 minutes later. DO NOT ORDER FROM THEM
I placed an order an hour and half ago they told me 30-40 minutes and never showed... I am hungry, left my confidence in you and you left me on read there better be a good reason.

Not sure how I order drive up pick up, and no one actually brings the pizza out. I really want a refund back. That's my fault for tipping upfront. Lesson learned. If you're handicap and can't make it in the shop, avoid ordering from this location.
They had the nerve. They said I didn't have a light so they couldn't tell that I'm in a white pickup truck. I sat here and watched you look at me. Then you played with the computer, next thing you know, I get my order was picked up notification. How Sway.... I guess they got a free pizza to take home or sell on the side. $5 dollar pizza anyone?????

reviews.author_name: I SLAY ALL DAY TRAVEL The Solo Traveler
reviews.text:
This place is black owned and with that being said a rare jewel in DC!  It has great drinks and the food is a drinkers paradise. This place is vertically integrated (owns the building) and one of the only spots without gentrification in DC.  The bartender lover is the greatest bartender they have here.

Every Wednesday they have a cigar pairing...

I'll be back!!!  This is my new sport.  By the way, the mixed selection of music from jazz to R&B is superb!!!

Love the energy in here.  Even Mr. Tony who is a regular who sells cigars.

JUST COME HERE!!!

I’ve been here three times. The have decent happy hour specials. But Overall, I didn’t like my food. Tried the jerk wings, crab cake and The oxtail dinner. The oxtails were $26 total, which is crazy overpriced. My food looked nothing like the dish online. It also didn’t taste well. When I had the jerk chicken it wasn’t good either. I wanted to support throw place because it’s black owned but they really have to step up their service and the quality and consistency of their food.

This is a hidden gem in DC. The place is small, but they do have an upstairs i have never been too. The people are friendly and it feels like your local bar with that friendly atmosphere. Shout out to the bartenders who make good drinks and are very informative about the drinks and menu options. We have added this place in rotation to out hang outs.

Lemon pepper wings and the shrimp and grits!

Staff is cool, they let me borrow a phone charger. Felt like a home town bar surrounded by all these tourist bars, and made my night.

Those grits,  dude.

Found this place on UberEats. They actually have a Caribbean Restaurant pop up there. It’s good. It’s gives a neighborhood vibe. Don’t judge a book by its cover. Didn’t get a chance to go upstairs but there’s an upstairs area too.

Weird experience with pickup but the food was decent. I had paid for a cheese Danish but it wasn't included in my to go bag (good thing I checked) so I asked and they said said they were out. No worries... but there was no offer to replace or refund or anything. So I had to ask to take a different Danish vs them proactively offering. Also I paid extra for a large coffee but it was the same size as the small. Apparently they don't have large... then why allow people to pay extra for it online? It's a shame because the place looks cute and the food was pretty good.

Stayed at an Airbnb nearby so we went here three days in a row for breakfast before heading out for the days adventures. Small but has some seating for dine in. Local cops, remote workers, families and middle school students stop by for quick snack, breakfast, lunch or to work. Had so many juice options, smoothies, coffee, baked goods, breakfast and lunch options. We only ever tried breakfast and it was so good. The omelets are super packed full of meat and veggies. Caramel frappe is delicious (basically a dessert lol) and the people were nice. If it’s not too busy they’ll bring your food to you, but otherwise they call you up by what you ordered. Not something I’d drive out of my way to get but if I’m the neighborhood it’s definitely tasty option and they are consistent with the quality.

Located in a beautiful neighborhood, this was a good spot to grab a bite to eat. We had paninis off the lunch menu and was very impressed. Good flavor, good portions, and with Boar's Head meats and cheeses! Staff was nice and there was a relaxing atmosphere. Breakfast menu looks good too.
Quaint, cozy breakfast and lunch place. We were promptly greeted, order taken and then watched as our food was made to order. Delicious! Worth coming back.

Food Quality: delicious. Everything was hot and fresh.
Quantity for price: very fair. You definitely get what you paid for.
Ambience: welcoming and relaxed.

I had a breakfast sandwich and my girlfriend had a breakfast burrito (and an iced coffee). Both were delicious.

Definitely will be returning to the cafe.

Anything I eat from here is good haven't been let down at all not once. I drive 7 miles just to eat here the Chinese spots around me are trash. Hong Kong is gonna serve you right.

Updating with new photos because I'm still driving to get good food. The crab ragoons are my favorite i always order 2 1 for me 1 for the wife and kids lol

Typical Chinese restaurant. Pretty cheap food options though. Menu online was out of date so I added an updated one as of 3/5/21. Good sesame chicken combo. Rice was good, chicken decent. They use a heavy coating of bread on the fried chicken, but the meal was still good for the price. Will probably serve me for two meals worth
Very happy to have this great Chinese takeout place so close. The food is delicious and the portions are very generous. The only disclaimer is that it is cash only, so make sure to have some on hand!

Really great value and great Chinese food on the Hill!! The General Tao’s chicken was breaded well and the sauce was flavorful, the lo mein was packed and had a good flavor, and the egg roll was crisp! The only so so dish was the fried rice which was just fine. But overall will definitely order again!
Me and my husband favorite carryout... food is good

Hip Hop Fish and Chicken is another over rated restaurant for its seafood.  The fish season was off, the shrimp was super small with no flavor and the french fries had no flavor. But, the staff was helpful and friendly.
Never disappoints! Always fresh and perfectly cooked with great sauces.  Try the fried pickles and fried clams.

We found this location online the next day after the March on Washington in DC while it rained. DoorDash app works perfectly in the NE of the capital (not Postmates). We ordered catfish, fries, coleslaw and macaroni. The highlights are catfish, mac and slaw. Why? The catfish was properly drained and meaty. The mac was cheesy and thick. Overall the meal had the lyrical content, tonenality and instrumentation which every Jay-Z album possesses. Wonder why it's called HHFC because it was all synchronized like a well-oiled orchestra. Can't wait to visit and order delivery soon again from this location. Succulent and savory are the best words to describe this place.

I think a lot of people probably sleep on this place, but they're the bomb! I'd actually rather go here to get my chicken than KFC or Popeyes!! Their chicken has great flavor! They have a variety of sides and desserts to choose from. Also, their iced tea/lemonade mix is delicious!! Lastly, the prices are great! Food comes in a big box (reminds me of the old school joints that aren't around anymore). Come try them out!!

The catfish is the best your going to get from a fast food location. I will keep coming back for it!! The chicken is good nothing to brag about or complain about. Don't waste your time with the desserts.

name: Little Pearl
vicinity: Carriage House, 921 Pennsylvania Avenue Southeast, Washington

reviews.text: It is a great space filled with plants and natural light… the staff were so warm and inviting from the moment we entered. The food didn’t blow my mind like other Michelin restaurants but it also doesn’t have the price of others. Overall, a nice night out and a good date spot that won’t break the bank.

Enjoyed the dining experience here. The service was personable and the atmosphere casual for fine dining. The course meal was quite innovative and well balanced. The dishes were flavorful with great execution and ingredients, and some creative surprises along the way. Because we were sitting next to a heat lamp, the photos obviously didn’t do the meal justice.

Little Pearl absolutely surpassed my expectations. They greet you with a welcome drink and proceed to have their staff guide you through a mix of small starters (a take on a deviled egg, a bit of chicken on a fancy chip, etc) and larger proteins. So many restaurants fall down on the dessert course but the cheese crumpets and the apple tart-ish dessert were such a treat. This is a Michelin star work going to again. Dinner is $85/ person, cocktails are $14-$16. All in with tax and tip with two drinks was ~$140.

It was a disappointment compared to rose's luxury and pineapple & pearl overall. Cocktails and caciocavallo stuffed crumpet were definitely the highlights for the night. However, for other courses, there were some playful flavor profiles with herbs but nothing very special. Wine pairing was mediocre. Our napkins had many wrinkles, the lights were flickering. Not much fun on the tablewares either.

Edit: I have written a new review on my alternate account to reflect my second experience at Little Pearl after being invited back by the team. Kudos to them for reaching out to me after a less then ideal New Years experience. I appreciate their willingness to make it right and they delivered on that promise. I do understand that the holiday service was most likely extremely stressful and that what I experienced was due to short staff and the extra long service they made available with the 10pm seating. I am fortunate to have had another opportunity to learn what the chef and restaurant was all about and would be delighted to take friends and acquaintances to visit in the future. Thank you again to our waiter and the rest of the Little Pearl team for providing such an enjoyable evening.

The food was fine, so that’s not the main reason I’m writing my review. I’m writing because over the overall I experience that I had during their 10pm New Years seating that I don’t feel was up to the standards of Michelin star. To start, they were 25 minutes late to seat us. We had to stand in a small entranceway while we waited. Once we were seated, we went directly to the table and were not seated at the bar for drinks and appetizers like the website stated was the experience. Maybe this was because they were behind schedule, but I’m not sure why the diners should be penalized for the Resturant’s ineptitude. Once we were seated it was another 15 minutes to be served our first course. So it took around 45 minutes from the start of our reservation to start eating. The waiters seemed unorganized and not at the top of their game. Something just felt off for such a fine dining establishment. Maybe it was because of the holiday and this wasn’t their A team. When I asked for them to take pictures of us, they seemed impatient and only took one or two of poor quality. Most resturant staff are now prepared to take photos and make an effort to do a good job and take several. Again it just felt odd. The most surprising part of the night was the midnight toast. The resturant did not do anything special. They did not stop the service to do a countdown, play music, or bring the diners together in any celebratory fashion. In fact, we were being served our dessert and my partner had to stop the waiter in order for us to countdown and do our toast. If they hadn’t stopped him, he would have talked right through midnight. So in conclusion, no special menu for new years, $55 up charge (150 per person instead of $95) then on a regular night, and lackluster service. Just not what Ive come to expect from a Michelin Resturant’s.
Was in the area and decided to try this place out. Ordered shrimp fried rice and a side of broccoli. The rice was bland and tasted old/stored. Worst SFR I've ever had to be honest.
Polite service and big serving sizes.  But the wonton soup had no veggies and the wontons were mainly thick pasta. The teriyaki chicken was delicious and a good deal
This place is my go-to in the neighborhood for takeout. It is so yummy, affordable, and just all around classic Chinese takeout.
Amazing food and even more extraordinary staff!!! The only carry out I’ll go to !! 🙌🏼🙌🏼

Will never order from this place again!! Eggs rolls were bland and I've never had sticky shrimp fried rice before. I hate to waste food but this was just horrible!! Oh and they charge a delivery fee that's not mentioned on their menu.
Unfriendly, but food was still what you’d expect from McDonald’s not worst or better than any other

9/23/22 8:04 am lil girl taking my order in the inside misheard me and got mad when I refused to take what she rung me up for so I offered to repay for my correct item and she proceeded to yell at me then yelling/telling her manger what happened so I then said either refund me my money or ring me up for my correct drink so she came out with my correct drink in a size small I said thank you and she said nothing. Very rude and for little reason at that

This place forgets an item or two every single time I pick up from here. So check your order before leaving! Also pre ordering on the mobile app is pointless because you still end up waiting 10 minutes when you get there.
They are slow on the inside and drive through. Ordered fish sandwich value meal. The French fries was almost burned and bread on the fish sandwich was stale. Poor customer service.

app says they're open at 5 AM. it's 5:22 and I am unable to place a mobile order.

update: so much for 24 hours lol

Really friendly staff & the pizza is very tasty! We had the medium veggie pizza & it come out so quickly--we were shocked! Beautiful thin crust. Can't share a pic of it because we gulped it down too fast ;)
east fast and good food!! got the mild wings which were not spicy at all but still had good flavor. will be getting the hot next time. and they made us a half and half pizza with two specialties.

Pizzaiole is brand new to the Capitol Hill area! The lunch special they have is probably one of the best I've ever got in D.C. the slices are HUGE. The staff also is really nice, the gentleman remembered, my order and name from the first time I ordered there. I was very impressed and will be back for sure!

Highly recommend this spot as your new go-to local pizza place. I was skeptical, but it’s under new ownership as of 2022 and the quality is incomparable to the establishment that was here before; the dough is a well prepared thin crust and the cheese, sauce, and toppings are very good. This pie compares well stacked up against We The Pizza, Vace’s and Andy’s. As a bonus, the new owners seem like great people!

This place just re opened under new management and we can't recommend it enough. Pizza was delicious, my kids say it's " Best pizza ever!". The wing was great as well. Order was ready on time and their customer service is amazing. They had 30%off as their reopening special. This definitely is our new pizza place.

I tried the chicken and shrimp burrito with double rice and salad. It was pretty good and authentic. My husband had the beef nachos, they were ssssooo cheesy but he enjoyed them. Service was friendly and helpful for me just ordering take out.

This place has been a staple since 1996. It's authentic fare and the staff is very personable.  I ordered the criollo pollo and the chicken was so tender and juicy with lots of onions and tomatoes. I gave the food four stars because the chips were over cooked and the owner tried to justify it's supposed to be like that. I had to go to the car to get my own. However, once seeing this the women staff demanded new chips to be cooked; so we got another batch that was good.  Overall, it's a nice local spot to visit.

Best neighborhood Mexican joint on the Hill, probably the city. Makes me feel back at home in the Southwest. This isn't some fancy 'traditonal' place that charges you double cause they happen to serve mole. It's just go to comfort Tex Mex (and like most places around here some good El Salvadoran as well, cause that's who's doing the cooking). It's locally owned and they've been around for a long time. Go check it out

FREE CHIPS ‘N’ SALSA !!!!!! man, I know it’s only like $3, but when a bowl of warm chips and fresh salsa is just brought to your table, you just feel good.

Great Tex-mex. Huge portions. Fast staff.

The worst customer service ever if you order with Uber. Neither the restaurant nor Uber take responsibility for errors and basically care less if your food is late, cold, or subpar. The manager is rude and defensive and will shout you down - despite your patronage. If you don’t want to receive soggy, salty, poorly proportioned food, don’t order from this restaurant. It’s a waste.

Their green curry is now one of my favorites, the spice level is excellent. The dish would have been perfect if the sauce wasn't so thin like they made it the day before and if they would have left out the red pepper(this flavor over powers everything in a VERY bad way!) When I ordered I asked for NO PEPPERS IN MY FOOD.

The pad see ew, didn't have the proper searing on the noodles and lacked sauce. Big ball of dry noodles.

Crab Fried rice was great! Except they loaded it with(you guessed it) red peppers! The person who ordered this loved it and so did I, they just put way too many peppers on this dish. It took away from the sweetness of the crab.

The chicken satay was juicey and tender! The peanut sauce was great!

The mango lemonade was so good!

Stay away. This place has terrible Thai food, it’s more like carry out imitation Thai food. I ordered crispy basil chicken and first it wasn’t crispy it was soggy. I can tell they made the dish with frozen low quality  tenders or something. It tasted like they cooked it then froze it and re heated it had the freezer burn taste to it. We need some better Thai food with good service.

This is not a dine in place. They still have it set up like Covid where it’s blocked off and you order through a glass partition.

They are a little pricey but you get huge portions.  My food was delicious. I got Jumbo shrimp rolls. And I believe the entree dish I got was called Thai fried rice. with crabmeat, chicken, shrimp, and veggies.

Pretty bad. Iced coffee was good but the food did not taste Thai at all. I ordered delivery, so it might be better in person, but it was very bland and the flavor profile was closer to Mexican food (I had the panang curry).

Stop by for a bite. Service was great. The staff was so kind and accommodating. The food is some of the best Thai I've had in a while. So much flavor and some good spicy kick if that's your thing. Great selection of food. Good size portions. A great place to get something different to eat in your travels. I'll be stopping back.

I went by this restaurant before they had soft opening, talk with chef, review menu. So today I actually had a chance to go inside beautiful place, nice atmosphere. I was told special is shrimp and grits. That's what I ordered, yummy 😋. delicious. to my surprise it had sausages added. super yummy
I pay more than I normally would pay for shrimp and grits, however the flavor got my attention. I will go back to try my original plan meal which is Belgian waffles with orange syrup in the meal name two eggs your way which comes with potatoes, bacon or turkey sausage. go see for yourself you will not be disappointed. 😋

Really cute building in a quiet neighborhood, at least it was quiet when I went. The service was good and everyone was attentive. There were a few items that we ordered but the kitchen and bar were out. As a Jamaican, I just think that’s apart of the experience. Don’t get mad or upset if the kitchen/bar is out, just have a back up. Everything I had was really good, so just take your pick of what is available. I had the wings, calamari, oxtail and cheesecake. I recommend all of them. It was my brother’s birthday and the GM/owner brought him a slice of cheesecake with a candle. The place was really clean and modern. I highly recommend! The chef was chefing!! No complaints from anyone in my party of 6.

Great food and great experience. We had dinner with the family here for my husband’s birthday. Friendly and attentive staff. I recommend dining here and I’ll definitely return. I didn’t capture all the food in pictures, but everything was yummers ;-)

I stopped by today bc I was notified that the owner graduated from
my alma mater (many, many years later).   I did get to meet and chat with Clayton. I’m very proud of him and wish his business much SUCCESS.  And, Capitol Sq Bar & Grill is on Success Road.

I ordered the open faced steak & cheese with a salad and fries. This was primarily for my husband, but I tasted each in order to give an honest review. The steak was tender and prepared as requested. The salad was very nice with a variety of greens, not just lettuce, and a delicious dressing.  Now, the fries…tasty and crisp, but way too much salt. When I come again, I’ll request that the chef go easy on the salt, and I’ll sit down and enjoy my meal while it’s hot out of the kitchen. Oh, see my photos of inside and out.

My husband and I decided to take a walk and explore some of the many new restaurants popping up in our neighborhood and stopped in to DC Capitol Square Bar & Grill. We watched over the months in anticipation as the place was being renovated. We were planning to visit 2 other restaurants when we realized that this place had opened so we stopped here first. We took a few minutes to look over the menu and we were greeted by the Chef Damian who gave us some insight into the menu. We ordered the wings to keep us simple and leave some room for food from our next destination. I can tell you that the wings DID NOT DISAPPOINT! First I'll start by saying that the presentation was nice. They use a berbere spice (Ethiopian) which gave the wings a phenomenal taste that wasn't at all overpowering. The sauce that came with it was pinkish in color and was great, but our server brought out a cilantro lime sauce that was even better. The decor is nice and there is a ton of outdoor seating as well as seating upstairs also. Staff was also super friendly. I'm looking forward to coming back to try a few more items in the menu. Happy to see another great restaurant open up in the neighborhood!

Very glad to have this place join the neighborhood. You may recognize it from Union Kitchen. The pizza is fantastic with great crust and pepperoni (always a good sign when it curls). Loved both the cheese and pepperoni Nonna style equally, which is pictured. Always had the Detroit style which just as crispy and delicious. Cute small seating inside with summer seating and seasonal pizzas to come.

I got the nonna pizza with pepperoni and black olive. The pizza WAS FANTASTIC!! First of all, black olives are hard to find in DC pizza places, so Della Barba already has a leg up. BUT THE PIZZA WAS 5-STAR. The sauce, the crust, the cheese - all perfectly balanced and delicious. Crust was crispy on the outside but tender and fluffy and flavorful inside.

Will be back for sure!

I've worked 5 years in pizza places and for several years now make my own in a pizza oven at home, and I can say this is the best pizza in DC. The dough rise and crispiness on the Nona and the garlic bread are excellent. The toppings and cheese are high quality. My wife got the Detroit style mini and she said it was excellent also.
Priced slightly higher than We the Pizza, but not by much. Nona is more than enough for 2. It might not look as big as a large from Domino's or PJ's, but more flour made for better rise and crispness, and still fills you up just as much if not more.

After ordering several pizzas from Dells Barba when they were at Union Kitchen, I was super excited that their brick and mortar opened 2 blocks from my house. Alas, was thoroughly disappointed today with what they are charging for their wares. 2 pizzas (Chicago w/ meatballs, Detroit w/ pepperoni) with tax and tip was $85 carry out! Pizza sizes were TINY for the prices they charge.

This pizza was good and filled us up. The cheese was melty and stretchy like you want it and the crust was really good though a bit more airy than a traditional Chicago pie (I lived in Chicago, thanks for asking.)

We got two deep dish pies and a salad for three people. We have almost a pizza left. I’m not sure what all the fussy reviews are about. I’m thankful for this addition to our neighborhood and looking forward to them being around for a while.

Have been meaning to check this place out for months and I finally made it here for a Sunday brunch to meet with an important acquaintance. First, brunch runs until 3pm so I was disappointed to not be able to try the Nugs here. I have egg allergies but the build your burger option is a good look if you are looking for a non-brunch food brunch option. The drinks were tasty and it took a bit to get used to the app-only ordering system. The burgers are the thin smashed style so I definitely recommend at least two patties. While on the small side, the burgers were still very tasty. Seems like it would be a great place to hang out for a late night drink or snack so I’ll have to come back soon!
I think this is my new favorite burger in the DMV! The nuggets ... also delicious. I will be coming here more often. I wish they opened for lunch during weekdays...

So a few disclaimers. 1. I veery rarely give out 5 stars across the board. 2. I'm an every now and then burger person, 3. I generally don't like the qr code/quasi self serv place. 4. I generally don't visit the same place twice as I'm all about variety.

This place blew all of that out of the water.

Dinner and drinks:
The first time I came here was  1 day ago on a Thursday night with a bunch of people and that first night was epic. I'm right back here Saturday morning.
That first night we ordered a bunch of plates for the table and there's something for everyone! The sauces are awesome my fav is the HEB sauce. They even have veggie chicken nugs and veggie patties. My bf didn't even realize they were vegetarian they were that good. I'm not a fan of the breading per se but that's just because I like minimally breaded chicken.

Brunch
I came back Saturday morning with my bf  we were one of the first two parties of the day.
We got the first half smoke of the day, the heb breakfast burger, the banana fosters casserole thing (it's huge sweet and amazing!), the cluck city, and breakfast potatoes.  Splitting everything gave us a chance to taste it. I've been in DC for several months and hadn't had a half smoke yet. This place way exceeded my expectations.

We definitely will be back

Some things to know:

It's an intimate place which is great because it doesn't get super loud. But if you have a big party do the place a favor and give them a heads up so they can accommodate you.

They use the qr code system to order. Once you're setup it's pretty seamless!

They add 20% service charge which frankly I'm here for. Pay living wages and that way I don't have to tip (becuase tipping culture in America started as a way to steal wages from emancipated black Americans but I digress)  I'm here for that plus it's double digit inflation just charge more, be transparent and that way I can dine guilt free!

Tried the Lancaster Burger (double patty). Burger patty was okay, but not awesome. Our order came in very fast, but burger itself was warmish and the bun was just cold. Didn’t feel like we are eating a fresh crispy burger. The smoked flavors didn’t come through at all. I think patties could be improved a lot. Sauces tasted great though.
I also ordered the smoky Rum cocktail and it was really really good. Five 🌟 for the drink, 3 🌟 for the burger, so I give it a 4 star.
Will go back to try different burger to see if this was one off experience because other people seem to love it!

Update:
Went back and tried it again. The burger was hot, juicy and tasty, curly fries were cool. I hadn’t tried it at other places. They added GF bun to the menu. It means they listen and definitely on the improvement track. Burger is really really nice, but still like Red Apron’s burger across the street a tad more.
Rooms for improvement: smokiness flavors do not quite come through, the burbon used in cocktails could be of better quality. Ambiance is nice but the music has room for improvement
; one of the speakers seemed to be off.

Came here for my fiancés birthday with 5 people and everything was wonderful. The burgers were delicious- loved the option to have mine on a bed of arugula instead of a bun. The homemade sauces were awesome to have with the fries; the HEB sauce was my favorite. And don’t sleep on the house made sodas. The chili ginger soda was refreshing with the perfect chili kick. The staff, especially Kendrick, Susie, and Ben, made us feel right at home. The vibe of the space is unique and cozy. We sat in a comfortable booth perfect for our group of 5. In sum, we will definitely be returning and are so glad to have HEB in the neighborhood. thank you for such an enjoyable evening!
Excellent cheese sticks!
I've gotten takeout from here a bunch and it's always delicious. My favorites are the Cambodian noodle salad and shrimp dumplings (as delicious as from Maketto but closer).
Wanted to like it - but the food was unmemorable. The place has a bit of a Food Court vibe. Complicated App - obligatory to order/pay/tip from it. Odd to tip BEFORE you actually get any service.
underrated!
